meanings.definition: A person holding religious beliefs other than those of the main world religions.
meanings.sent1: The paganists gathered in the forest to celebrate their beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She studied the ancient texts of the paganists to understand their faith.
meanings.sent3: The group of paganists decided to have a picnic in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: In the town, they were seen as mysterious paganists, living on the outskirts.
meanings.sent5: The colorful robes worn by the paganists caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Belonging to or characteristic of pagans.
meanings.sent1: The artifacts displayed in the museum were of paganists origin.
meanings.sent2: Her necklace had a paganists symbol engraved on it.
meanings.sent3: The garden was filled with paganists statues, giving it an ancient feel.
meanings.sent4: The old castle had a paganists aura, with its stone walls and mystical air.
meanings.sent5: The music playing had a paganists rhythm, invoking a sense of nature.

meanings.sent1: The paganists rituals were performed under the full moon.
meanings.sent2: He followed the paganists traditions passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a paganists routine of napping in the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork had a paganists touch, inspired by nature and spirits.
meanings.sent5: The forest glowed with a paganists light, as if touched by magic.
